attributes.action: To make August Bank Holiday Monday reclassified as ‘England Day.’
attributes.background: Given the rich and illustrious history of England, I propose that this day be given a new name and purpose and call it 'England Day?’ By a stroke of good fortune, historical evidence suggests that this time of year coincides with the emergence of England as single sovereign state, 1091 years ago.
attributes.additional_details: Living in England is a great privilege and we should celebrate this. The transition from Bank Holiday Monday to England Day, couldn’t be simpler or more convenient, coming in late summer it would be part of the three-day holiday. This proposal is not competing with St George’s Day. This proposal seeks to promote a public holiday that already exists, by giving it status and relevance. If this idea appeals to you, please add your name to the petition.

attributes.action: Oppose Wigan Council Application No. A/16/82503/CU
attributes.background: Wigan Council is planning on converting Evolution Nightclub / 36-44 King Street Wigan into restaurants, cafes and residential units. This will seriously damage the nightlife in Wigan and cause many job losses. King street is made up of bars and clubs and employs hundreds of people.
attributes.additional_details: If this plan goes ahead, it will mean that the bars and clubs on King street may receive noise complaints and may have to reduce their noise levels and operating hours. Wigan cannot afford any more unemployment in the town and many of the staff are now worried that they could lose their jobs over this. King street is dependant on its nightlife and see's 1000's of customers every week. Having a residential area in the middle of the street is only the start of what negative's it will bring

attributes.action: Public Inquiry and full disclosure of corrupt covert operations
attributes.background:
Request for:
- Public Inquiry
- Full disclosure of official files 
of crimes by State of Human Rights violations against innocent individuals and / or their families subjected to misuse of covert operations and secrets act (including removal of exclusion notices to the innocent person's file).
attributes.additional_details: A person or family to be placed under covert operations must be a threat to national security by government, law enforcement, secret and security organisation, such as espionage, serious crimes and terrorism.  An innocent person exercising their legal rights in any context that is to democratic laws / policy is not a threat to State. Neither should be subjected to misuse of covert operations and their Human Rights violated.  All records collated constitute criminal evidence by such contravention.

attributes.action: Place more stringent requirements on school meals that are served at break.
attributes.background: Currently, at our school, the main meals are healthy, the menu varies and the quality of the produce is high, but as not all of the standards on health, quality and variety apply to break food, the same things are served every day. Fruit is there, but this is expensive and placed in a corner.
attributes.additional_details:
All school health standards should be applied to all meal servings, along with more defined legislation regarding variety and quality, especially for food served at mid-morning break. This will allow students to eat healthier options, eat a variety​ of food and know what they are consuming, no matter the time, is of high quality.

Food served at mid-morning break includes:
Pizza slices
Belgian Waffles - which are sprinkled in sugar
Donuts
Paninis
Bacon and cheese rolls - where there is 1cm of fat on each piece of bacon

attributes.action: It is Now time to Abolish Abortions, 200,000 foetus murdered in the UK in 2015.
attributes.background: Since the Abortions were first legalised in 1967, approximately 22,000 abortions were carried out. This figure has increased over and beyond expectations. Time to Stop Abortions Now

attributes.action: Change the railway lines for a faster train from Weymouth to London
attributes.background: The train takes 3 hours From Weymouth to London (138 miles) and it takes 2 hours 44 minutes from Liverpool to London (222miles).The old Victorian lines are not good enough for a faster train.

attributes.action:
Ban 0845 type numbers
Stop service providers charging customers contacting them
attributes.background:
Essential utility and service providers charge customers who need to contact them by phone
Identifying, reporting and resolving service delivery problems is an integral part of their business and should not constitute an additional source of revenue.
customer contact must be free - eg 0800 numbers
attributes.additional_details:
National service providers should provide customers who buy their utilities or products with free vectors of direct communication.  It is unethical to charge paying customers additional fees to speak to their service providers.
These, and other barriers to communication, serve to discourage customers from raising complaints and identifying problems. Opportunities for utility providers to monitor and maintain  service quality and delivery is therefore unfairly restricted and limited.

attributes.action: Cycling revolution will cure the nation’s poor health.
attributes.background: 67% of men and 57% of women in the UK are overweight or obese. Coronary heart disease , stroke, type 2 diabetes, colon cancer , breast cancer, osteoarthritis , depression , dementia are just some of the diseases that can be prevented/delayed by doing regular exercise...
attributes.additional_details:
Imagine how much money could be saved by the NHS (£115 billion spent p.a.) if the population was healthier. This money should be spent on the following:
-More bike stands throughout the UK, a significant increase in Boris bikes and the introduction of Boris bikes in every city in the UK.
-A mass education program about the benefits of cycling in primary schools, secondary schools, universities and work places throughout the UK.
-Cycling facilities (e.g. lockers, secure bike sheds, showers) in the locations mentioned above.
-Longer cycle superhighways in London and superhighways in every city in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the NHS sharing patient records with third parties (e.g. Google).
attributes.background:
Patient records are confidential and should be available only to patients and healthcare professionals directly involved in their care.
Allowing access by third parties could, and almost certainly will, lead to improper use by insurance companies and marketing agencies.
attributes.additional_details: Sharing a patient's medical record with a third party should require specific authorisation by the patient.

attributes.action: Independent, more stringent scrutiny of MPs' interests, influences & conflicts
attributes.background: Need independent body with more stringent rules/codes on all historical, current & planned outside interests, potential influences & conflicts of interests, & their full declaration, so our elected/non-elected representatives work to the highest ethical & moral standards that engender public trust.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM & all MPs/candidates should be scrutinised by an independent body using more stringent, clear rules & do the honourable thing accordingly.

1.	Aim is to increase public trust in our democratic process & our politicians.
2.	Need to minimise conflicts of interest/influence that might bias MPs’ opinions, decisions, actions etc. (including investments, corporate/foreign deals, donations, second jobs, consultancies etc.); need full declarations at point of potential impact.
3.	Need transparency based on plain-English declarations of conflicts (not just posting tax returns that can hide all kinds of other investments/financial interests).

attributes.action: Allow a step-father to be named on a marriage certificate.
attributes.background: Only the biological fathers name is currently permitted on a marriage certificate.
attributes.additional_details:
That's extremely unfair to the step-father's that do a better job and are more deserving of the title. With proof of a marriage certificate, we should be able to record the step-father's name on the form.
Step-fathers were previously permitted to be named, however that rule changed in February.

attributes.action: Give English voters a say in the event of a 2nd Scottish Independence referendum
attributes.background: Nicola Sturgeon is calling for a new Referendum on Scottish Independence. In the event such a referendum is granted, we demand that a vote is given to all English voters to give us a choice on whether or not we want to keep Scotland, and move our military contracts South of the Border to England!
attributes.additional_details: http://www.msn.com/en-gb/news/uknews/nicola-sturgeon-launches-second-scottish-independence-referendum-drive-after-brexit-vote/ar-AAioSmM?li=BBoPWjQ

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Sellers should complete building survey before the property goes on the market
attributes.background: When selling a property the building survey should be completed by the seller before it can go on the market, so that all parties involved are aware of any serious defects.This would expediate the process for buyers, who often only discover the property's faults late in the process, but also sellers
attributes.additional_details: Although the current rules are supposed to offer protection, as Sellers are meant to inform Buyers of serious defects if a previous sale has fallen through etc this is often not enforced. Instead late in the process, after the Buyer has already paid for a host of surveys, the true cost of the property becomes apparent. Having the survey completed first would make everyone aware of all issues at the start of the process, making life easier for all involved.

attributes.action: liquid vapours for e cigs to be hidden behind shutters like cigarettes
attributes.background: Im a non smoking mum who knows many young children getting hooked on e cigs & vapour pens, which no doubt will continue onto cigarettes. Liquid vapour needs to be behind shutters like cigarettes. Currently being advertised like sweets in a sweetie shop. Needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently caught my 11 yr old son  a vapour pen! I discovered that most of the yr 6 in primary school were smoking. Advertising is aimed at kids lemon soufflé, trifle, bubble gum & Coca Cola flavours. Once hooked they will Start smoking cigarettes to increase the tobacco industry sales. 
Today most people are trying to quit smoking so hence tobacco sales declining. The tobacco industry are now hoping to encourage younger generation. These liquid vapours need to be behind closed doors.

attributes.action: Additional EU Referendum for ALL Expats.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a rule to trigger an additional EU Referendum for all expatriate British Citizens, regardless of the length of time they have resided outside the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details:
If implemented the result of the June 2016 EU Referendum means the United Kingdom would leave the World’s most influential network of nations on the base of a remarkably thin majority for such a huge step.
This is the decision of a lifetime to ALL British Citizens, wherever they live, yet the outcome was based on an undemocratic principle.
The millions of British citizens residing outside the UK are not only grass-roots ambassadors of the UK spread all over the planet but are affected by the result of the EU Referendum just as much as, if not more so, than UK residents.
However, millions of expats resident outside the UK for more than 15 years were not eligible to vote and were in effect disenfranchised. Therefore the result is not democratically legitimate.

attributes.action: To enforce that the CMS deal with both maintenance & contact thorough mediation
attributes.background: For the CMS to enforce that mediation must be attended by both parents in exchange for their  services. Both contact and maintenance are discussed and put to the courts. Solicitors and mediatiors can attend. Saving so much trouble and heart ache.
attributes.additional_details: Over the last two years I have gone through great troubles to arrange contact with my son Lucas. Since going through this I have noticed that there are several people going through the same... Alienation, unfair judgement in court, expensive solicitors. The CMS has sonics  legal power to peruse the money but don't do the same for contact. Making it easier to seperate a non living parent from their child with no obligation to maintain a healthy relationship between them. This must be stopped .

attributes.action: Those with IBD to be allowed parking spaces outside their home
attributes.background: There are an estimated 300,000 people living with IBD in the UK, and not all of these people can register as disabled. This means that those who don't have a driveway or a designated parking space outside their home can struggle to park and get inside quickly when suffering a flare up.
attributes.additional_details:
A painted bay, or a designated parking space outside a sufferer's home would make a great difference.
It's not just IBD, there are thousands of people within the UK that suffer from chronic illness that would benefit from a parking space outside their home.
Local councils will not help as some sufferers cannot register as disabled, and therefore are not legally obliged to help and in may cases won't.
We're not asking to park in disabled bays, just the ability to park outside our own homes.

attributes.action: Hold a voter registration and information day in all schools for 16 year olds.
attributes.background: We are lucky enough to live in a peaceful, democratic country, where each and every citizen has a say in who runs the country. The importance of taking part in democracy and voting cannot be stressed enough, yet information and education on the importance of voting is minimal.
attributes.additional_details: Too often the 18-24 year old demographic has amongst the lowest turnout in elections and referendums. The importance of voting cannot be overstated, yet there is little information on the process and importance of participating in democracy for young adults. Should 16 year olds be able to register to vote in their final year of secondary education they will have two years to learn about our democracy and consider their views, before being eligible to vote at 18.

attributes.action: Investigate the Use of an Oral TB Vaccine for Badgers.
attributes.background: The US are saving an endangered species of ferret from Sylvatic plague using an oral vaccine deployed in food. Can we adapt these ideas and find an oral TB vaccine for badgers with a food we can deploy near setts for them to eat?
attributes.additional_details:
I Googled oral TB vaccine and found there is one for humans and it's more effective than the jab.Oral TB Vaccine: 

http://www.australasianscience.com.au/article/issue-december-2012/oral-tb-vaccine-better-needle.html

The main objection to vaccination has always been the difficulty in trapping and injection. This solves that problem.

Ferret Vaccination Details: http://www.theverge.com/2016/7/12/12161792/ferret-candy-vaccine-drones-montana

attributes.action: Non paying parents living partners income should be taken in to consideration
attributes.background: Child Maintenance should take in to consideration a non paying parents partners income whom they live with. So many parents do not pay for their children and many of these parents are actually working with either being paid cash in hand or their income being paid in to there partners bank account.
attributes.additional_details: The CSA used to take the partners income in to consideration but was later changed. Now it is easier for the non paying parent to not pay for their child which means the child is going without! I believe as many others do that if the non paying parent claims to have no income (nill rate) or little to none income and is living with their partner who is supposedly supporting them then their partners income should be considered to help pay towards the non paying parents child.

attributes.action: Fully-fund all disabled veteran British service people and their families.
attributes.background: For too long, the RBL Poppy Appeal and HFH charities subsidies care and support given to disabled returned service people and their families. Taxation is being squandered on Trident when the real cost has already been incurred. It is morally wrong to depend on charity. It's the government's duty.
attributes.additional_details:
1/ The amount spent on Trident is obscene.
2/ The shameful shortfall required to barely fund care and support currently is being topped up by charities. Without it they would be even worse off. 
3/ It's been going on for too long.
4/ The Government has all the stats. What they need is the guts and moral stamina to take care of our fallen. Fully.
5/ The Poppy has become a symbol of successive Government's failure to care for our damaged service people and their families.
6/ It's our moral duty.

attributes.action: Hold General Election once a Tory leader's found & before Artcle 50 is triggered
attributes.background: The U.K. Government should represent the people of the U.K.  Following the recent referendum both major parties at Westminster have seemingly imploded. Once new party leaders have been found the UK should decide who is right to govern them.
attributes.additional_details: This should also be done before Article 50 is invoked so that the Prime Minister leading the negotiations has the backing of the people

attributes.action: Reduce corporation tax to less than 12.5% give companies a reason to stay in UK
attributes.background: Post Brexit vote we need immediate action from the government as many companies will already be planning to leave the UK. Time is of the essence and we need to halt a mass exodus of  businesses and secure jobs for Britain. In-party politics should take second place to measures such as this.

attributes.action: To implement a Civil Law consequence to racist and xenophobic behaviour.
attributes.background: We need to promote tolerance and equality now more than ever. This proposal is IN ADDITION to The Equality Act 2010. A number of racist and xenophobic offences do not reach a conviction in court due to a lack of evidence. We propose that some incidences could be settled under Civil Law.
attributes.additional_details: Proposal: Party A is victim to racist or xenophobic behaviour by Party B. Party C is witness to the event and gives a statement. A document states Party A will not press charges if Party B agrees to pay a significant fine OR attends a Humanity awareness course which will aim to educate and promote tolerance and understanding. The course completion will be subject to the course provider certifying that party B demonstrated remorse and engaged with the subject matter.

attributes.action: Make BBC Parliament exempt from the TV licencing requirements
attributes.background: It is ridiculous at best, and undemocratic at worst, that in order to watch our elected representatives at work we're required to pay the BBC a licence fee. Whilst the argument is understandable for other BBC services, we should not have to pay to watch the democratic process of our country at work.

attributes.action: Use government resources to co-ordinate a modern Buy British campaign.
attributes.background: We can make and grow world-class produce and services in the UK.  Buying British is the most effective way to avoid recession now and spur long-term GDP growth regardless of EU membership.

attributes.action: Raise the voting age in the UK to 28
attributes.background: Due to the level of immaturity shown by the majority  of young people today, lack of respect and generation culture, i feel that at 18, youth dont have not enough experience  to make  judgements that could possibly lead to a nations future.
attributes.additional_details: Lack of participation in national referendum, as low as 28%, meaning they either lack the fundamental knowledge or they just cant be bothered.

attributes.action: Verify the quantum of EU Referendum votes made on the basis of lies & untruths
attributes.background: The 23 June 2016 EU Referendum, has set a path for the UK which is likely to cause significant damage to the economy and send the UK into recession. It has emerged that many voters cast their votes on the basis of lies, untruths and misrepresentation of facts by both the Leave & Remain campaigns.
attributes.additional_details:
Following the Leave and Remain Campaigns backtracking on the various promises and statements that they made to the electorate,  the leading polling consultants have now determined that many voters cast their votes on the basis of these claims that have now been proven to be lies and untruths and many voters have confirmed they would now cast their votes differently.

The Government needs to determine if this sample is statistically relevant and if it could have affected the outcome of the result

attributes.action: Stop Imports from Germany
attributes.background: The 3 month forecast shows for the month of April, the UK spent nearly 9 billion pounds on imports from Germany alone, Now that we have voted as a country and have decided to leave the Eu they are playing around with the pound, Nothing has stopped as of yet and trade remains the same. And for why ?
attributes.additional_details:
We need to stop trade with Germany, We need to stay together as a country and stay strong, Lets not let them play us, we can trade else where. 
https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/527976/OTS_Release_0416.pdf

We need to focus on world trade and get our £ on a good exchange and to do this we need to stop trade with those who are trying to bring us down.

attributes.action: now that the British people have voted , we need an updated  magna carta
attributes.background: now that the British people have voted to leave the eu, one of the wrongs needs to be righted, a British bill of rights is needed to include an updated people's magna Carta to include the original laws but updated for the 21st century, also if possible to be signed &  agreed by the head of state
attributes.additional_details: the magna Carta was signed by the then head of state king John, to protect the people's rights for lawful imgresses, parts of the laws were watered down or revoked by various people over the centuries, therefore losing said rights, but some still stand as of today & as this was the peoples choice to leave the eu, those in charge, parliment etc, should now be held accountable by the said people as/if the  need arises

attributes.action: Propose a referendum on whether or not HM Government should trigger Article 50.
attributes.background: Following the EU referendum and the fact UK citizens can now see it's effect more clearly and are better informed of future plans, we the undersigned propose HM Government hold a further referendum on whether or not to trigger Article50. The result of this should then determine a 2nd referendum.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is due to the sheer number of people expressing they voted incorrectly to leave, some as a "dissatisfaction" vote and the fact the vote was too close to be a satisfactory result. Also the backtracking on spending proposals (eg NHS) clearly left many feeling deceived by the out campaign. UK citizens deserve honesty and integrity from their leaders to make truely informed decisions and that did not happen.

attributes.action: Companies/organisations fined for hate speech in uniform/insignia or on premises
attributes.background: As a deterrant against post-referendum racism and to encourage a wider sense of collective social responsibility, we believe that penalty fines should be served on registered companies and organisations that own the uniform, insignia, premises or property in/with which an act of hate speech occurs.

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum to decide on a 2nd British referendum on EU membership
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to implement a referendum to decide on whether another EU referendum will take place. If the yes vote is more than 60%, then a second EU referendum, also with a 60% majority threshold requirement for the winning side, should be held.

attributes.action: Give UK citizenship to all migrants living in the UK on the 23rd June 2016.
attributes.background: Let's start the UK's move to full sovereignity with a promise to migrants, both EU and otherwise,  that they will be entitled to full citizenship if they were registered as living in the UK on the 23rd of June 2016.

attributes.action: A second referendum should be carried out in the event that the EU reforms.
attributes.background: Due to fears of other countries exiting the EU, a reformation may take place within the union. If this does occur, then the UK should have another opportunity to decide whether it wishes to remain in a reformed EU or not, prior to the triggering of Article 50.
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland may well be having another referendum for their independence due to the changed circumstances between the UK and the EU. Similarly, should EU reformation occur, the circumstances will  have changed. Therefore, the UK should be given the opportunity to have a new referendum on its membership in the EU.

This should be carried out prior to the triggering of Article 50 to ensure that our position and influence in the EU is maintained.

attributes.action: Abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as UK voted for democracy.
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to abolish the monarchy and the house of lords as they are unelected and a barrier to having a full democracy in the UK. This is something that has proven to be a public priority with it helping to secure a leave vote in the recent EU referendum.

attributes.action: Review campaign rules / media regulation on stigmatisation of demographic groups
attributes.background: In the UK, loosely regulated media and political propaganda has been used extensively to stigmatise and marginalise demographics, particularly those in minority groups. More should be done to protect groups and individuals from becoming targets for political or financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Media content and political campaigns, including headlines, tag lines, articles or information and imagery, specifically taken out of context or construed with the intention to promote concern, fear and isolation of any group or culture that exists fairly under UK law, should be regulated to protect the public from attacks of violence and hatred.

attributes.action: Bring the perpetrators of rape in the Democratic Republic of Congo to justice.
attributes.background:
Young girls and I mean young [under 5 in some cases] are being taken from their homes gang rapped and then left. 

I would like the UK to put pressure on the Congo offering police help if needed to stop this wave of rape and oppression of young girls.
attributes.additional_details:
You can see the story here
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/jun/20/girls-gang-raped-suspects-free-democratic-republic-congo-president-kabila?CMP=share_btn_fb

attributes.action: Call for a vote of no confidence in PM Cameron post EU referendum.
attributes.background: In the event of a leave majority in the forth coming EU referendum we the people request that all Members of Parliament be made directly aware by the House of Commons Speaker to the announcement of our desire for a vote of no confidence in Prime Minister David Cameron.

attributes.action: Make vaccine inserts mandatory to receive before being given any vaccination.
attributes.background: This isn't about being pro or anti vaccinations. This is about knowledge and being able to make an informed choice in whichever choice you choose.
attributes.additional_details: By reading the vaccine insert it will help educate the person on the possible adverse reactions, it will help parents notice vaccine damage a lot earlier if it arises, you will be able to read the study details and see all ingredients in the vaccination before deciding to go ahead with them.

attributes.action: Make car parking charges illegal in or around public parks
attributes.background: For as long as I remember, most public parks were for families, friends, dog walkers and couples etc to enjoy the sceneries, taking walks, picnics or generally just feeding the ducks and birds. But more and more public places are now charging people to park.
attributes.additional_details: This is unfair now on people with little mobility, elderly and families that just wanted to spend a day out without having to pay. Places like Mote Park in Maidstone for example which has now started to charge parking fees. They justify this on the local government website by stating that this is to "keep it at the high standard residents and visitors have come to expect, as well as allowing for vital improvements". I am intrigued as to when they started to "keep it" at any standards.

attributes.action: Mandatory air rifle registration with a 2 year period to register.
attributes.background:
Make mandatory registration of air rifles.
Currently in the UK anyone can own an air rifle & use these to illegally shoot on lands without permission committing the acts of armed trespass and poaching.
Some shoot pets escape prosecution and costs owners thousands of pounds!
www.ukgunbook.com
attributes.additional_details:
By making registration mandatory ( 2 year period to register ) it will help solve crimes of pets that have been shot and / or killed.
It will also make sure that owners are punished for offences committed with their weapons.
We dont want to stop people shooting, we just want to ensure those that own weapons are using them sensibly, on lands with permission.
Similar to the UK Gunlaws on ShotGun ownership.
£15 per weapon registration and £10 per year renewal fees for up to 10 serialised weapons.

attributes.action: Make a ‘car mode’ setting a mandatory feature on all new smartphones.
attributes.background:
We believe that car mode will reduce the number of accidents on our roads.
Specifically, car mode would, when activated, and until such time it was turned off. Disable all phone calls, text messages and any form of application-based alerts that require the user to interact with the phone.
attributes.additional_details:
26% of all car accidents were caused by drivers using a mobile device (1 in 4). Connected Driver Survey 2015 - MORI Social Research Inst. 

Dialing a phone increases you chance of having an accident by 12 times while reading or writing a text increases your chances of having an accident tenfold.
According to a RAC Foundation survey, 60% of people "would be happy to use a 'vehicle safe mode' on external devices in cars."

attributes.action: Debate the EU's Five Presidents’ Report & its likely impact on the UK.
attributes.background:
The report proposes the completion of Europe’s Economic, Monetary & Political Union.  It uses the terms 'euro area' and 'EU' in relation to its propositions; thus a likely impact on non-euro sovereign states such as the UK.
My concern is that our MPs are not fully aware of its content or impact.
attributes.additional_details:
The report can be accessed at: https://ec.europa.eu/priorities/publications/five-presidents-report-completing-europes-economic-and-monetary-union_en.
It states, 'And finally, towards a Political Union that provides the foundation - - - '. 
It uses doublespeak such as, 'The euro is a successful and stable currency', not withstanding the intractable problems a common currency has given countries such as Greece.

attributes.action: Hillsborough families compensated in full for 27 years of legal fees.
attributes.background: The Hillsborough victims families have for 27 years had to pay their own legal fees unearthing the truth of what happened on 15/04/89. The South Yorkshire Police and others held responsible for the tragedy that day have had their legal fees paid by the tax payer. Another miscarriage of justice.
attributes.additional_details: The families of the 96 people who died at Hillsborough have had to endure 27 years of pain and heartache uncovering what they always knew was the truth. The families themselves and campaign groups have had to find exorbitant amounts of money to fund a fight that should never have had to be fought whilst the establishment have continued to fund their cover up and lies fully funded by the tax payer.

attributes.action: Erect a statue of a famous woman on Parliament square.
attributes.background: Parliament Square has statues of famous men in history. There are many women of importance that have contributed to our democracy surely this should be reflected in our most important landmark. Example Emily Pankhurst helped give women the vote.

attributes.action: Debate whether self-regulation of the press is adequate.
attributes.background: The UK press is constantly coming under fire for misrepresenting stories and misleading the public with inflammatory opinion pieces that purport to be news items.
attributes.additional_details:
“the press is given significant and special rights in this country ... With these rights, however, come responsibilities to the public interest: to respect the truth, to obey the law and to uphold the rights and liberties of individuals. In short, to honour the very principles proclaimed and articulated by the industry itself (and to a large degree reflected in the Editors’ Code of Practice)”.
- Sir Brian Leveson

Some newspapers are clearly failing to 'respect the truth'.

attributes.action: Invest more money into front line policing increase number of response officers
attributes.background:
More and more officers are being assaulted each year. With the lack of numbers it will soon become a huge safety issue. 

On top of that, too often we hear the story that response officers to not have the time, resources or funding to deal with/investigate an offence.
attributes.additional_details: 2015 saw a police officer assaulted every 22 minutes in England & Wales. This is a growing number and we need to invest to protect not only the public from these damaging cuts but the officers themselves.

attributes.action: To create separate employment laws for big businesses & micro/small businesses.
attributes.background: Corporate law does not recognise that small business cannot afford to offer the same 'rights' as big business, such as lengthy paid maternity/paternity leave etc. However, it can offer a more rewarding work environment, where every employee is an individual who is vitally important to the business.
attributes.additional_details: Because every person counts in a small business, it cannot afford to lose an employee for extended periods and pay cover. But by choosing to work in a micro/small business, employees could opt for shorter paid maternity/paternity leave, fewer paid sick days etc. in exchange for other benefits such as greater flexibility in working time & time off. Plus an environment where each employee is vitally important to the success of the business and there is greater equality between the boss and staff.
